text: What does your response body contain?
May I know how can I show different search results if I have 3-4 themes being developed under one developer account? I see for Theme 2 onwards search result template inherits design of Theme 1.
You need to set the search results page in the global website settings area. So click on the settings icon in the too right corner then go down to website and it’s in the system pages a section

Please check the screenshot <https://www.awesomescreenshot.com/image/9174145?key=9411891de6de643362974f825a96737c>. I have multiple themes. How can I specify Miva search result to be used for Miva theme and SOftek search results for Softek theme? Under system pages,  I can select just one from drop down.

I am not sure I understand — are you saying that youre site is using a handfull of themes and you want to use them all as their own search result page? I suppose this wasnt built with that intention. I thin kthis was built with the udnerstanding that one portal would have one design and only need one default search page. If youre looking at customizing them you will likely need to build out your own search page in each theme and use the Search api to query your site

Hello everyone, this is Tessa from the HubSpot Product Team.  We’re looking for developers who are interested in participating in user research to provide feedback on new and existing features, functionality, and resources for developers. Participants will *play a critical role in helping to improve our dev tools and will receive compensation for your time, typically ranging from $50-$200* for a 30 minute to 2+ hour commitment. We’d love your input!  If you’re interested in joining our panel, *<https://www.research.net/r/L7FHHRY|please fill out this questionnaire>* so that we can identify the study that will be best for you.  If you have any questions about the panel, please feel free to DM me or post them in the thread here as well.

create coded module and use group.id parameter.
